subtopic.sub_topic_name: Types and methods of data transmission

description: (a) Understand that data is split into packets for transmission.
(b) Describe the structure of a packet.
learning_objectives.notes_and_guidance: Packets contain a header, payload, and trailer. Headers include destination, source addresses, and packet number. Packets may follow different routes, can arrive out of order, and are reassembled on arrival.

description: (b) Explain suitability of each method in different scenarios.
learning_objectives.notes_and_guidance: Methods include: serial, parallel, simplex, half-duplex, full-duplex. Advantages and disadvantages should be compared.

learning_objectives.description: Understand USB interface for data transmission.
